ticket.title: Email multipart 2 years old bug
ticket.original-body:
Hi, i've found this bug, and it seems it's 2 years old, not yet corrected. http://www.ruby-forum.com/topic/62419
Reporting that post:
Hi,
I use the multipart functionality from the action mailer.
But when i send an html message, my outlook opens the mail and shows this:
--mimepart_4443b76d12268_6f34..fdacc616831e6 Content-Type: text/html; charset=iso-8859-1 Content-Transfer-Encoding: Quoted-printable Content-Disposition: inline
<!!Message> = = --mimepart_4443b76d12268_6f34..fdacc616831e6--
No html will appear. When i look in the source every tag is changed to <style type=3D"text/css">.
Anyone know how to fix this?
Thanks in advance
Rick

No html will appear. When i look in the source every tag is changed to <style type=3D"text/css">.
Anyone know how to fix this?
Thanks in advance
Rick

= = --mimepart_4443b76d12268_6f34..fdacc616831e6--

No html will appear. When i look in the source every tag is changed to .

Anyone know how to fix this?

Thanks in advance

Rick

version.title: Email multipart 2 years old bug

version.body:
Some code to test it: *** notifications.rb: def alert @sent_on = Time.now @from = 'test@test.com' @recipients = 'test@test.com' @subject = 'test' @body = {:reqst => '
test
'} end *** alert.text.plain.erb: <%= @reqst %> *** alert.text.html.erb: <%= @reqst %> *** console: >> x = Notifications.create_alert => # bodyport=#> >> x.encoded => "Date: Sun, 12 Oct 2008 21:30:13 +0200\r\nFrom: test@test.com\r\nTo: test@test.com\r\nSubject: test\r\nMime-Version: 1.0\r\nContent-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary=mimepart_48f250492c08b_2098..fdbfb1b7e3e0\r\n\r\n\r\n--mimepart_48f250492c08b_2098..fdbfb1b7e3e0\r\nContent-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8\r\nContent-Transfer-Encoding: Quoted-printable\r\nContent-Disposition: inline\r\n\r\n
test
=\n\r\n--mimepart_48f250492c08b_2098..fdbfb1b7e3e0\r\nContent-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8\r\nContent-Transfer-Encoding: Quoted-printable\r\nContent-Disposition: inline\r\n\r\n
test
=\n\r\n--mimepart_48f250492c08b_2098..fdbfb1b7e3e0--\r\n" As you can see is:
test
It adds that 3D (ascii: '=') and that cause the wrong rendering on a lot of email clients :(
version.body-html:
Some code to test it:

*** notifications.rb:

def alert

@sent_on      = Time.now
@from         = 'test@test.com'
@recipients   = 'test@test.com'
@subject      = 'test'
@body         = {:reqst => '<div style="color:red">test</div>'}

end

*** alert.text.plain.erb:

<%= @reqst %>

*** alert.text.html.erb:

<%= @reqst %>

*** console:

x = Notifications.create_alert => #<TMail::Mail port=#<TMail::StringPort:id=0x..fdb902954> bodyport=#<TMail::StringPort:id=0x..fdb8fff88>> x.encoded => "Date: Sun, 12 Oct 2008 21:30:13 +0200\r\nFrom: test@test.com\r\nTo: test@test.com\r\nSubject: test\r\nMime-Version: 1.0\r\nContent-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary=mimepart_48f250492c08b_2098..fdbfb1b7e3e0\r\n\r\n\r\n--mimepart_48f250492c08b_2098..fdbfb1b7e3e0\r\nContent-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8\r\nContent-Transfer-Encoding: Quoted-printable\r\nContent-Disposition: inline\r\n\r\n

test
=\n\r\n--mimepart_48f250492c08b_2098..fdbfb1b7e3e0\r\nContent-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8\r\nContent-Transfer-Encoding: Quoted-printable\r\nContent-Disposition: inline\r\n\r\n
test
=\n\r\n--mimepart_48f250492c08b_2098..fdbfb1b7e3e0--\r\n"

As you can see is:

test
It adds that 3D (ascii: '=') and that cause the wrong rendering on a lot of email clients :(
version.title: Email multipart 2 years old bug

version.body:
I've come across this on the formatting of links in text/plain emails. It is the encoding method "quoted-printable" that is responsible for converting '=' to '=3D'.
I found an explanation here: http://ask-leo.com/why_does_my_email_sometimes_show_up_with_funny_characters_like_0d_in_it.html
So it would appear that this is not a bug, and probably a problem with the email client.
version.body-html:
I've come across this on the formatting of links in text/plain emails. It is the encoding method "quoted-printable" that is responsible for converting '=' to '=3D'.

I found an explanation here: http://ask-leo.com/why_does_my_e...

So it would appear that this is not a bug, and probably a problem with the email client.
version.title: Email multipart 2 years old bug

version.body:
Hmmm…I'm running into this as well. I have a multipart email that is sending "text/html" as one part. In order to fix, I need to set the part's transfer_encoding equal to "none" (p.transfer_encoding = "none" within a part block).
Since Rails is sending the email, it sort of is the client.
version.body-html:
Hmmm…I'm running into this as well. I have a multipart email that is sending "text/html" as one part. In order to fix, I need to set the part's transfer_encoding equal to "none" (p.transfer_encoding = "none" within a part block).

Since Rails is sending the email, it sort of is the client.
version.title: Email multipart 2 years old bug

version.body:
In process of writing a patch. Then I just realized @Theo probably meant the '=3D's are fine and the problem is email clients that cannot interpret them are buggy.
I can confirm the '=3D's, but if the Rails team is saying the '=3D's are fine, then there is no reason to keep this ticket open.
version.body-html:
In process of writing a patch. Then I just realized @Theo probably meant the '=3D's are fine and the problem is email clients that cannot interpret them are buggy.

I can confirm the '=3D's, but if the Rails team is saying the '=3D's are fine, then there is no reason to keep this ticket open.
version.title: Email multipart 2 years old bug

version.body:
Further reason to close this and forget it ever happened -
We've found that transfer_encoding set to "none" triggers some spam filters out there to spam our emails. The best alternative seems to be to set to "none" in development so emails look nice in the console log and leave at "quoted-printable" in production and test.
version.body-html:
Further reason to close this and forget it ever happened -

We've found that transfer_encoding set to "none" triggers some spam filters out there to spam our emails. The best alternative seems to be to set to "none" in development so emails look nice in the console log and leave at "quoted-printable" in production and test.
version.title: Email multipart 2 years old bug

version.body: Closing ticket based on Barry Hess's comments. If anybody thinks this ticket should remain open, just make a comment and I'll re-open it.
version.body-html: Closing ticket based on Barry Hess's comments. If anybody thinks this ticket should remain open, just make a comment and I'll re-open it.
version.title: Email multipart 2 years old bug
